sub_title: Consultant Sustainability Governance & Learning | Indonesia, SE Asia, The Netherlands
summary:
I am a consultant Sustainability Governance & Leaning currently based in the Netherlands with an advanced degree in tropical agriculture, development economics and forest policy. 

Sustainable and responsible ways in which people relate with one another, nature and society have driven my education and career. I am fortunate to be part of a global network of professionals and activists on social and environmental sustainability, as well to have made part of the world of women, men, girls and boys at the very local levels.

I have over 25 years experience in grass roots action and in development & research in predominantly rural, agricultural and forest contexts focusing on adult & stakeholder social learning and adaptive collaborative management and governance. Since more recently, I have put my efforts in contexts of resilient and equitable food systems, the SDGs, climate change, youth inter-generational learning, and Greater Jakarta flooding.

I have been engaged with international NGOs (Plan International, Save the Children US), CGIAR (ICRAF and CIFOR) and started in 2013 my consultancy providing services to e.g. FAO-RAP, RECOFTC, Samdhana Institute, EUROTAFE, and the Indonesian Embassy in The Hague. I've partnered with IDN, IPB, KRKP, WUR, RCCC-UI, Indonesian Min. of Environment & Forestry, Indonesian resp. Dutch Climate Envoys, INYS, NJR, SDSN Youth, Energy Academy Indonesia, SDSN Indonesia/SEA & Youth, PPI, Plennid Rotterdam, WRI Indonesia, La Galigo, UU, TUD, and Technotrend.

My experience is in (multi-country) project management, institutional development, NGO network coordination, (participatory action) research, stakeholder & youth workshops, conference moderation, and (multilateral) grant management with as outcomes workshops, webinars, manuals, policy briefs, newsletters, reports, proposals & (semi) scientific writings. 

I have been involved in Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand, and the Netherlands; reached out to Cameroon, China, India, South-Africa, and US., and work-visited Bangladesh, Kenya, Nepal, New Zealand and Zimbabwe.

Please feel free to contact me at yanti@tykusumanto.nl or by dropping me a LinkedIn message.

projects.title: Indonesian-Dutch Youth Dialogue for a Sustainable Future: Exploring bilateral partnership on youth development and engagement towards the Sustainable Development Goals
projects.description:
The Indonesian-Dutch Youth Dialogue for a Sustainable Future was intended to identify and explore areas of bilateral partnership between the Netherlands and Indonesia in connection to youth development and engagement in achieving the SDGs. It took place at a critical crossroad as Indonesia, the Netherlands, and other UN Member States had dealt with the negative effects of economic globalisation and global environmental challenges such as climate change. 

Participants were representatives of youth-led and youth-focused organisations as well young individuals from both countries, residing presently in the Netherlands. Among the participants were students, (social) entrepreneurs, community leaders, activists, and professionals. 

The dialogue was hosted by the Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia to the Kingdom of the Netherlands and was collaboratively conducted by TYK research & action consulting, Centre for Sustainable Development Studies (CSDS) of the University of Amsterdam, Indonesia Nederland Youth Society (INYS), Indonesian Diaspora Network Nederland, and the Dutch Youth Council (NJR). The theme of the Youth Dialogue is “Eradicating poverty and promoting prosperity in a changing world,” which is the theme of the UN High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) that convened from 10 to 19 July 2017. The dialogue discussed the following SDGs:
Goal 1: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture;
Goal 5: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
Goal 8: Promote sustained, inclusive, and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development.

For the the dialogue's report, please see publication section.

projects.title: Needs assessment bilateral partnership Indonesia - The Netherlands towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
projects.description: This needs assessment is intended to identify and explore areas of cooperation between the Netherlands and Indonesia that are deemed necessary and offer potentials for bilateral cooperation within the SDGs framework. This assessment is carried out in July-October 2016, both in the Netherlands and Indonesia by way of a) desk study on literature and development policy documents and b) consultation with goverment, universities, business sector, civil society, and public media. The study is initiated by my own consulting organisation while complementary funding is being sought, See: Needs Assessment SDGs IDN-NL (Slide share).

projects.title: Gender mainstreaming strategy for Dedicated Grant Mechanism in Indonesia (part of The World Bank`s Forest Investment Program)
projects.description: The objective of this assignment is to provide the DGM Indonesia National Steering Committee and National Executing Agency a strategy to mainstream gender in community-based natural resources management engaging indigenous peoples and local communities in 7 regions of the country. Among the expected deliverables are strategies to promote evidence-based decision making in interventions that are supported by the DGM Indonesia project. The project is financed by The World Bank and is part of the Bank’s global Forest Investment Program (FIP).Project implementation is with Samdhana Institute.

projects.title: FAO-RECOFTC Project on gender mainstreaming into forest policies in Asia-Pacific
projects.description:
A. April-July 2013: Indonesia Country Study. This study comprised policy reviews, context study, indepth interviews, FGDs and a field visit involving government officials of the National Planning Agency (BAPPENAS), the Ministry of Forestry and the Ministry of Women's Empowerment and Child Protection, FAO staff, ILO staff, staff of NGOs/CSOs, community workers, women's group members and academics/researchers. Indonesia was one of the eight countries in Asia-Pacific where country studies were conducted.
B. October 2013: 25th Session of Asia Pacific Forestry Commission (APFC) in Rotorua, New Zealand:  
1) Jointly prepared and facilitated with B. Upadhyay (RECOFTC) a Regional Workshop on Gender Mainstreaming into Forest Policies. The one-day workshop was hosted by RECOFTC as an important pre-session of the 25th Session of the APFC. The workshop provided opportunity for the participants to present and discuss current challenges and opportunities with regards to integrating gender perspectives into national forest policy highlighting their country contexts. Participants were government officials of eight member countries of the Asia-Pacific Forestry Commission (APFC), namely, Cambodia, Fiji, Indonesia, Nepal, Philippines, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Vietnam and gender researchers.
2) Observed APFC Member States Meetings.
C. November 2013-May 2015: I developed with Bhawana Upadhyay (RECOFTC) and Toon de Bruyn (Consultant) initial training materials of a manual for gender mainstreaming into forest policies and practices for Asia and the Pacific. The manual has been published in August 2016. In December 2013 I presented the outline and concept of the manual at a regional Expert Workshop on Gender Mainstreaming into Forest Policies in Asia Pacific to solicit views of country representatives of eight countries in the Asia Pacific Region.

profile_positions.description: Areas of expertise (please see also Projects): Social, ecological and economic inclusiveness in dealing with Greater Jakarta flooding; Concept and implementation scheme Indonesian-Dutch youth dialogue towards the SDGs (with focus on SDG1, SDG2, SDG5, SDG8, and SDG17); Gender mainstreaming strategy for Dedicated Grant Mechanism Indonesia for indigenous peoples and local communities (WB funded project); Partnership concept of Dutch-Indonesian bilateral cooperation towards the SDGs; Bandung Asian-African Conference: Moderator ecology & gender plenary and Convenor of roundtable on equitable and resilient food systems in the Global South; Indonesia country study gender inclusiveness in forest policies and practices (FAO funded project); Training manual on social and gender inclusiveness in forest policies and practices in Asia-Pacific (FAO funded project); Conference concept agroecology, climate change and food security in Indonesia; Initiate, produce and coordinate Webinar Series Young-led Climate Partnership in collaboration with ECADIN: Proposal development of renewable energy with engagement of schools and of integrated food and energy systems in Jakarta and NTT, Eastern Indonesia in collaboration with Delft University of Technology, Utrecht University, Ecadin, Technotrend Foundation, University of Indonesia, Bandung University of Technology, Bogor Agricultural University, People's Coalition for Food Sovereignty (KRKP), and United in Diversity Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Consultant sustainability governance & learning

profile_positions.description: The Global University for Sustainability (Global U) is an initiative that supports the proliferation of autonomous, self-managing local bodies and their interdependent networking for ecological justice and socio-economic justice. The Global U is an experimental forum for alternative practices in the production and use of knowledge, making possible different modes of relating to one another and to nature.
profile_positions.title: Founding member

profile_positions.description: Responsible as project officer for management support on female condoms supply chain management to collaborative partners covering production (China, India), testing (USA), country studies and social marketing (Cameroon, S. Africa). i+solutions made part of a partnership with Oxfam-Novib and Rutgers Foundation Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Project officer , Consultancy & Training Department

profile_positions.description: Worked on doctorate study related to social learning and the role of science in sustainability and forest governance in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Independent researcher social learning, science, and forest governance

profile_positions.company: CIFOR - Center for International Forestry Research
profile_positions.description: As research site coordinator, I looked together with a field team into a learning-based approach to collaboration called Adaptive Collaborative Management (ACM). We researched the preconditions, strategies and outcomes of fostering collaboration among stakeholders in a complex and uncertain social and natural environment. The research focused on creating opportunities for shared learning through participatory action research (PAR) carried out by the stakeholders, facilitated by our team. The PAR was focused on the attainment of village forest rights and customary rights. It considered women as an explicit stakeholder group. Along the way and in a learning-by-doing mode, we developed stakeholder facilitation methods, tools, and how-to guides. As Sustainable Forest Management (SFM) monitoring & evaluation tool we used CIFOR's SFM Criteria & Indicators. As necessary, I coached CIFOR and NGO partner field staff. Besides, as part of a global research group on Forest Landscape Restoration (FLR) I contributed with aspects of stakeholder collaboration and adaptive management. I wrote implementation manuals, progress and scientific reports, and (scientific) publications. I was based at Headquarters (Bogor) and the Jambi research site (Central Sumatra).
profile_positions.title: Social Science Researcher Adaptive Collaborative Management, Forests and Governance Programme

profile_positions.description: Managed ADB RETA (Regional Technical Assistance) Project implemented by ICRAF in collaboration with National Research Institutes, Universities, and Government agencies in Indonesia, Philippines, and Thailand. Managed donor grant and liaised with donor (ADB). Contributed to assessments of the institutional aspects of land use change and policy impact on land use change. Wrote and contributed to reports and publications.

volunteer_experiences.description: I initiated and co-coordinated a lecture and demonstration series on Classical Javanese Performing Arts involving artists and lecturers. The message of the Project was that performing arts from the ´East´  is not only about traditional norms and customs, but also about concepts of arts and esthetics, just as  the case is with Western performing arts. The Project received overwhelming response from the public.
